âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fetches GitHub stars using user credentials. â€¢ Extracts text from repository titles, descriptions, and README files. â€¢ Applies Term Frequency Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF) for keyword extraction. â€¢ Uses Non-Negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) for topic modeling.
ðŸ“– Summary: This Python script automatically sorts a user's GitHub stars by topic using machine learning. It fetches starred repositories, extracts relevant text from their titles, descriptions, and READMEs, and then applies TF-IDF and NMF to identify topics and categorize the stars accordingly, generating a browsable folder structure in Markdown.
